features: Just Pop and Enjoy:Our microwave popcorn makers are designed to make movie nights even more enjoyable. With our set of two single-serving popcorn makers, you can easily make as many servings as you want, so you can enjoy your favorite snack alone or with friends and family. Plus, it's incredibly easy to use.

Safe and Toxin-Free: Our popcorn popper makers are made with high-quality, BPA-free, and PVC-free silicone material that is heat-resistant and toxin-free. You can use little or no oil and still enjoy healthy and delicious popcorn without worrying about any harmful chemicals.

Enhanced Design for Secure Closing Lid: Our Silicone Microwave Popcorn Popper Makers feature an interlocking "Buckle" design that ensures all the kernels stay safely inside without spilling out. Enjoy a healthy and delicious snack without the mess.

Quick and Simple: Our popcorn buckets doesn't require any oil or butter. Simply pour in one ounce of uncooked kernels along with your favorite seasonings and heat in the microwave to enjoy freshly popped popcorn anytime you want.

Easy to Clean and Store: Made with durable silicone, our resuable popcorn maker is dishwasher safe and can be stored without taking up too much space. It's reusable, simple to use, and makes enjoying theater-style popcorn at home a breeze.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Do you like the taste of air popped popcorn the best, but don't like the noise and time? Do you like the convenience of microwave popcorn, but don't like carcinogens? Do you like the lack carcinogens when using a paper bag to microwave my own kernels, but don't like the waste of paper? If yes, you must give a try in this Deeponde Microwave Popcorn Popper bucket! This resuable microwave popcorn maker bucket will revive your popping experience and make incredibly delicious popcorn in just 2-4 minutes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Adoreable and perfect for one
reviews.reviewText: I really shouldn't eat a huge bowl of popcorn, this one makes a rational serving. Of course, I can always go back for another batch! The concept is adoreable, and these work really well. They're thick and sturdy enough, I have confidence they'll last a long time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Watch the timing.
reviews.reviewText: Just received this today and decided to try it out. First time was a fail with a lot of the popcorn burnt. Tried again but reduced time to 90 seconds and it was perfect.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I don't like butter on my popcorn. Even at the movies, I get it dry and sprinkle plain salt on it.I used to be able to buy mini bags of micro popcorn. I think Redenbacher made them. I can't find them any more. Not plain, anyway.I wanted to buy a bag of popping corn but couldn't find a corn-popper.My husband doesn't like popcorn and the big micro bags are too big - I'd eat the whole thing.I found these on 'mazon and ordered them. I thought I was getting one but you get two.My micro is over the stove and is 7" tall, so these are just the right size.To use them, pour 1-1/2 tablespoons of dry kernels into the bottom of the cup.It makes about 2 cups of popcorn - just right for ME.Fold the flaps together and fit the small slots together so it stays closed.Micro for 2 minutes, open, pour into a bowl, salt, and dig in.Warning: these cups get pretty hot, so keep a pot-holder or dish-rag handy.When they've cooled off, rinse, air dry, and toss into the cupboard.I don't like buttery popcorn, so I haven't tried to use oil in them. I don't know what would happen if I did.Easy-peasy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars This popcorn container doesn't contain the popcorn.
reviews.reviewText: It was cool to learn that I could pop popcorn in the microwave without buying potentially chemically laden prepackaged microwave popcorn. But this is not the right vehicle for the popping. I pushed down the sides to make a lid, but the lid didn't hold, and the popcorn and unpopped kernels ALL came out all over the microwave. I'm returning this product and starting a search for something that's larger and has a secure lid.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I bought this as a gift for a friend and it did not work like it said it should. There is a small portion and it does not let the popcorn pop entirely. I would not buy this item again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Cute and easy to use.
reviews.reviewText: I ordered these popcorn popper containers to use in our RV and they are perfect for us. You simply put into the container a tablespoon or so of popcorn kernels, close the lid-which has 2 slits that lock it closed-and put in the microwave. I set mine on the popcorn setting and just listened for it to slow down popping. It popped almost every kernel as you can see in the pictures. I used Orville Redenbacher popcorn, don’t know if that makes a difference, and at the end of popping, the top had opened and a few pieces of popcorn had popped out. Very few and maybe I put too much in to begin with. I will try it again with a little less to see if it still happens. The other thing to know is that these containers do get very hot while popping corn! You will need to let them cool for a minute or so before taking it out of the microwave or use a potholder to take them out. They make the perfect amount of popcorn for one and the containers are a convenient size to hold while eating it. Just add your favorite toppings and your all set. I think we will use them a lot and think anyone, especially anyone who wants a single serving of popcorn, would love to have these.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I purchased these little buckets as a gift. I also have two for my home. 1 Tablespoon of popcorn, close the top, and microwave about 2 minutes. Perfect size for several children to share, or one serving. Great for home, but especially good to pop corn at work. No oil or butter or other chemicals. We keep my two going all the time. Plan to give as Christmas gifts.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I was looking for something my grown children could share and these are small enough to be for little kids.
